trans-unit.source: Port from OpenGL ES 2.0 to Direct3D 11
trans-unit.target: Port from OpenGL ES 2.0 to Direct3D 11

trans-unit.source: Includes articles, overviews, and walkthroughs for porting an OpenGL ES 2.0 graphics pipeline to a Direct3D 11 and the Windows Runtime.
trans-unit.target: Includes articles, overviews, and walkthroughs for porting an OpenGL ES 2.0 graphics pipeline to a Direct3D 11 and the Windows Runtime.

trans-unit.source: Port from OpenGL ES 2.0 to Direct3D 11
trans-unit.target: Port from OpenGL ES 2.0 to Direct3D 11

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: Includes articles, overviews, and walkthroughs for porting an OpenGL ES 2.0 graphics pipeline to a Direct3D 11 and the Windows Runtime.
trans-unit.target: Includes articles, overviews, and walkthroughs for porting an OpenGL ES 2.0 graphics pipeline to a Direct3D 11 and the Windows Runtime.

trans-unit.source: **Note** An intermediate step to porting your OpenGL ES 2.0 project is to use ANGLE for Windows Store.
trans-unit.target: **Note** An intermediate step to porting your OpenGL ES 2.0 project is to use ANGLE for Windows Store.

trans-unit.source: ANGLE allows you to run OpenGL ES content on Windows by translating OpenGL ES API calls to DirectX 11 API calls.
trans-unit.target: ANGLE allows you to run OpenGL ES content on Windows by translating OpenGL ES API calls to DirectX 11 API calls.

trans-unit.source: For more information about ANGLE, go to the [ANGLE for Windows Store Wiki](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=618387).
trans-unit.target: For more information about ANGLE, go to the [ANGLE for Windows Store Wiki](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=618387).

trans-unit.source: Topic
trans-unit.target: Topic

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Map OpenGL ES 2.0 to Direct3D 11.1
trans-unit.target: Map OpenGL ES 2.0 to Direct3D 11.1

trans-unit.source: When starting the process of porting your graphics architecture from OpenGL ES 2.0 to Direct3D for the first time, familiarize yourself with the key differences between the APIs.
trans-unit.target: When starting the process of porting your graphics architecture from OpenGL ES 2.0 to Direct3D for the first time, familiarize yourself with the key differences between the APIs.

trans-unit.source: The topics in this section help you plan your port strategy and the API changes that you must make when moving your graphics processing to Direct3D.
trans-unit.target: The topics in this section help you plan your port strategy and the API changes that you must make when moving your graphics processing to Direct3D.

trans-unit.source: Walkthrough sample ports from OpenGL ES 2.0
trans-unit.target: Walkthrough sample ports from OpenGL ES 2.0

trans-unit.source: This set of topics walks a number of OpenGL ES 2.0 graphics pipeline porting scenarios of differing complexity.
trans-unit.target: This set of topics walks a number of OpenGL ES 2.0 graphics pipeline porting scenarios of differing complexity.

trans-unit.source: OpenGL ES 2.0 to Direct3D 11.1 reference
trans-unit.target: OpenGL ES 2.0 to Direct3D 11.1 reference

trans-unit.source: Use these reference topics to look up API mapping and short code samples when porting from OpenGL ES 2.0 to Direct3D 11.
trans-unit.target: Use these reference topics to look up API mapping and short code samples when porting from OpenGL ES 2.0 to Direct3D 11.

trans-unit.source: Note
trans-unit.target: Note

trans-unit.source: This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
trans-unit.target: This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

trans-unit.source: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the [archived documentation](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132).
trans-unit.target: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the [archived documentation](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132).
